meanings.definition: The state or quality of being in orbit.
meanings.sent1: The orbity of the moon around the Earth is fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The satellites move in perfect orbity around the planet.
meanings.sent3: The orbity of the planets seemed like a graceful dance in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The orbity of the stars around the galaxy creates a beautiful cosmic ballet.
meanings.sent5: The orbity of the comet around the sun was a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The path followed by an object in orbit around another object.
meanings.sent1: The spacecraft's orbity around the Earth was carefully planned by scientists.
meanings.sent2: The moon's orbity around the Earth is elliptical in shape.
meanings.sent3: The orbity of the satellite around the planet resembled a graceful loop-de-loop.
meanings.sent4: The orbity of the asteroid around the sun was like a never-ending spiral.
meanings.sent5: The orbity of the comet around the sun traced a shimmering path in the sky.

meanings.definition: The distance between two objects in orbit around each other.
meanings.sent1: The orbity between the Earth and the moon is constantly changing.
meanings.sent2: The orbity of the planets in our solar system varies greatly.
meanings.sent3: The orbity between the two stars was so vast, it seemed infinite.
meanings.sent4: The orbity of the moons around the gas giant was like a delicate web of connections.
meanings.sent5: The orbity of the satellites around the planet was carefully measured by astronomers.
